title: problems with latin characters (50% solved)
body:
hi!

as many others have been reported using latin characters on a windows server doesn't work with owncloud.

today if you for instance has an external source mounted containing files with swedish characters like "ã¥ã¤ã¶ã…ã„ã–" the mounted folder will just be displayed empty in owncloud. even if several other non-latin files exists as well.

i recently tried to get pass the problem by changing the database character encoding from unicode to the windows character encoding "windows-1252" also known as "cp-1252". i'm using a postgresql database and created a new one using the sql query:

create database owncloud3 template template0 encoding 'win1252';
instead of 
create database owncloud3 template template0 encoding 'unicode;

the result in owncloud was that mounted sources with latin characters now would display all its content instead of a blank page with the exception that latin file names were presented as empty:

![owncloudmusic](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5108070/1137598/173d6d12-1c62-11e3-84c1-0d9e75611cd1.jpg)

however, the empty folders can still be used somewhat. for example, the url link to the empty folder in the image above is:

http://localhost/owncloud3/index.php/apps/files?dir=/musik/%5b02%5d%20album/gyllene%20tider%20-%20halmstads%20p%e4rlor

referring to the folder "[02] album\gyllene tider - halmstads pã¤rlor". which seems to me like a completely correct url encoded string!

also the correct folder file size is displayed. entering the album the files are displayed in a similar manner where latin files have empty file names:

![owncloudalbum](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5108070/1137629/1f6d9222-1c63-11e3-98c5-4efde78d06e4.jpg)

the strange thing is that the file suffix "mp3" is correctly displayed. also howering a file can give the link:

http://localhost/owncloud3/index.php/apps/files/download/musik/%5b02%5d%20album/gyllene%20tider%20-%20halmstads%20p%e4rlor/gyllene%20tider%20-%2001-01_det%20%c4r%20%d6ver%20nu.mp3

which is the song in the mounted folder:
"[02] album\gyllene tider - halmstads pã¤rlor\gyllene tider - 01-01_det ã„r ã–ver nu.mp3".

it can also be downloaded from the browser and played so access to the file is there.

being a programmer myself i know handling character encodings can be a bitch sometimes but solving this should not be impossible.
